text:
ðŸ‡­ðŸ‡· Croatia: Albina To Eurovision 2021
Croatia has selected Albina to represent them at the 2021 Eurovision Song Contest with the song “Tick-Tock”.
Dora 2021, Croatia’s selection show for this year’s Eurovision Song Contest, was broadcast live this evening from the city of Opatija, with Albina winning the right to represent the country at this year’s contest with the song “Tick-Tock”.
Tonight’s 14 competing acts and results (jury + public) were as follows:
Nina KraljiÄ‡ â€“ “Rijeka” (River) (68 + 77) 2nd Eric â€“ “Reci mi” (Tell Me) (29 + 16) 10th Ella OreÅ¡koviÄ‡ â€“ “Come This Way” (26 + 26) 9th Bernarda â€“ “Colors” (77 + 22) 7th Sandi Cenov â€“ “Kriv” (Guilty) (5 + 7) 14th ToMa â€“ “Ocean of Love” (64 + 39) 6th FIlip Rudan â€“ “Blind” (65 + 53) 5th Beta Sudar â€“ “Ma zamisli” (Imagine) (8 + 8) 12th Cambi â€“ “Zaljubljen” (In Love) (47 + 71) 4th Ashley Colburn & Bojan JambroÅ¡iÄ‡ â€“ “Share the Love” (9 + 34) 11th Brigita Vuco â€“ “NoÄ‡i pijane” (Drunk Nights) (7 + 8) 13th Mia NegovetiÄ‡ â€“ “Sheâ€™s Like a Dream” (67 + 52) 3rd Albina â€“ “Tick-Tock” (78 + 120) 1st Tony Cetinski & Kiki Rahimovski â€“ “Zapjevaj, sloboda je!” (Sing, Itâ€™s Freedom!) (30 + 47) 8th
The results of tonight’s show were made up of 50% jury and 50% public votes, with a total of 1160 points available given from both parties. Albina eventually won the highest points from both the jury and public, and will perform “Tick-Tock” in the 2nd half of the 1st semi-final of this year’s Eurovision Song Contest.
Image source: Renato Brandjolica / HRT
Croatia in the Eurovision Song Contest Croatia debuted in the Eurovision Song Contest in 1993, they were one of three countries to debut in the contest that year. Croatiaâ€™s best result came in 1999 when Doris DragoviÄ‡ finished 4th in Jerusalem. She performed the song â€œMarija Magdalenaâ€? which scored a total of 118 points, this included 12 points from Slovenia and Spain. Croatia returned to the contest in 2016 having withdrawn after the 2013 contest due to a string of poor results and financial difficulties.
